abstract.p: Paul Redfren letter comments on August 24 Critic's Notebook column on CBS reality program, Survivor

block.p: Re ''Machiavelli, on a Desert Isle, Meets TV's Reality. Unreal'' (Critic's Notebook, front page, Aug. 24):

Re ''Machiavelli, on a Desert Isle, Meets TV's Reality. Unreal'' (Critic's Notebook, front page, Aug. 24):

Before the final vote on ''Survivor,'' Kelly Wiglesworth, one of the two final contestants, said, ''Hopefully the better person will win.'' Richard Hatch quickly countered, ''Instead of who's the better person, it is about who played the game better.''

Richard's Machivellian mentality believes winning is all that counts. His actions and words imply that kindness and honesty aren't virtues, but moral straitjackets to be mocked or subdued on the road to victory.
There's one thing ''Survivor'' didn't teach Richard: survival without a soul is suicide.
